featured.title: Dispatches from Isolation
featured.author: Dev: Raunaq Singh | Design: Tyler Kliem
featured.description: Confusion. Chaos. Miscommunication. When Penn students test positive for COVID–19, nothing about the isolation process is clear.

featured.title: Penn, Interrupted
featured.author: Dev: Raunaq Singh | Design: Isabel Liang
featured.description: Pandemic, Protest, and Philly: Returning and Remembering in 2021.

featured.title: Dining Guide Fall 2021: Resetting the Table
featured.author: Dev: Raunaq Singh | Design: Isabel Liang
featured.description: COVID-19 shut down Philly’s restaurant scene for months. Now, our favorite eateries are back — but the menu looks different.

featured.title: Penn 10: Class of 2021
featured.author: Dev: Raunaq Singh | Design: Isabel Liang
featured.description: From working on the frontlines of the pandemic to creating inclusive spaces on campus, this is the class of 2021 Penn 10.

featured.author: Dev: Raunaq Singh, Akshay Sharma, Andy Jiang; Design: Isabel Liang, Felicity Yick
featured.description: How COVID-19 shook up the food industry

featured.title: Love Issue
featured.author: Calvin Hu, Nassim Motya, Peter Chen
featured.description: From Zoom dates to long walks around our blocks, here’s how Penn found love under lockdown

featured.title: Street Features
featured.author: Calvin Hu, Nassim Motya, Peter Chen
featured.description: Penn's most celebrated dermatologist experimented on incarcerated people. The University still hasn't owned up to his legacy.

featured.title: Best of Penn 2018
featured.author: Web Dev: Emily Saperstein, Ian Ong, Alex Graves
featured.description: It's that time of year again: Street's annual Best of Penn issue is here. You voted on your favorite food, drinks, shops, occasions, and communities and the results are in. Here are the winners of this year's 26 Best of Penn categories, plus Street staff's favorites for some oppositional fun.

articles.title: Dining Guide Fall 2018
articles.author: Web Dev: Jess Peng, Alex Graves, Daniel Salib
articles.description: Foodies rejoice! Dining Guide is back, and just in time for restaurant week. This semester, we’re branching out and exploring the full realm of food journalism, from restaurant reviews to personal essays. Everything is food related, but you might just be surprised by what you find inside…

articles.title: Entertainment Guide 2018: Philadelphia, Curated
articles.author: Web Dev: Alex Graves, Jess Peng, Daniel Salib
articles.description: For our Philadelphia, Curated issue, we spotlighted our favorite Philadelphia haunts that we wanted to share with our readers. From music venues and art galleries to comedy clubs and playhouses, we wanted to show you the best of what the city has to offer.

articles.title: Penn 10: Penn’s younger, cooler, 30 under 30
articles.author: Web Dev: Daniel Salib
articles.description: Penn 10 is a collection of student profiles spotlighting members of the senior class that have done incredible work during their time here.

articles.title: Dining Guide Spring 2018
articles.author: Web Dev: Jamie Tomlinson, Daniel Salib
articles.description: Your favorite issue is back with a mouthwatering vengeance! Inside you'll find your new favorite off–campus happy hour, tips on how to meal prep, and more. But don't read when hungry. You've been warned.

articles.title: Love Issue 2018
articles.author: Web Dev: Jamie Tomlinson, Alex Graves
articles.description: For Valentine's Day this year, we wanted to collect stories that gestured at the reality of love as we feel it: messy, sticky, weird, and something we can't claim to fully understand.

articles.title: Dining Guide Fall 2017
articles.author: Web Dev: Jess Peng, Andrew Fischer
articles.description: Step outside the Penn bubble and see what one of America's greatest food cities has to offer.
